hypothesis_content.title: Bear Regime Capitulation via Volume Spike & Wick Rejection
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BEAR regime, a daily candle with a pronounced lower wick (at least 3x the body size) accompanied by volume > 150% of the 20-day average signals a potential capitulation event, marking a local bottom and a high-probability transition point to a NEUTRAL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sustained bear markets end with panic selling. A high-volume spike that creates a long wick but fails to close at the lows indicates aggressive selling was fully absorbed by buyers at lower levels. This 'selling climax' pattern often exhausts the dominant downtrend, paving the way for stabilization and a regime shift to NEUTRAL.
entry_conditions: BTC daily candle has a lower wick at least 3 times the length of the real body (open to close range)
Daily volume is > 150% of the 20-day average volume
Entry on the next day's open

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the low of the capitulation candle
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 days after entry if regime remains BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: These high-volume wick patterns in BEAR regimes are more often followed by a brief consolidation and then a resumption of the downtrend, failing to trigger a regime change.
